name: Adolf Hitler RPG: Last Minutes of the Millennium Empire
name_original: Adolf Hitler RPG: Last Minutes of the Millennium Empire
description:
The date is 4/30/1945, the war is lost and Berlin is under siege. You have greeted your close confidants, secretaries, and military adjutants goodbye. Having just married your secretary the previous day, there is now only one thing left to do.

In this minimalist gameplay setting, you’ll have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the atmosphere of the room Hitler died in, examining its details and reflecting upon the weighty decisions that led to this historic juncture. The somber ambiance and subdued lighting contribute to a sense of introspection and contemplation.

As you navigate the room, absorb the stillness and solitude that surrounded Hitler in his final minutes. Delve into his thoughts, emotions, and inner turmoil as you sit on the couch, absorbing the weight of the impending collapse of the Third Reich. Observe the objects in the room, triggering introspective moments that shed light on the complexities of Hitler’s character and the consequences of his actions.

“Adolf Hitler RPG: Last Minutes of the Millennium Empire” is a departure from traditional gaming experiences, focusing instead on provoking thought, empathy, and understanding. It encourages players to explore the nuances of history and human nature, raising questions about power, ideology, and the moral implications of our choices.

Key Features:

• Immerse yourself in a single room, meticulously designed to capture the essence of Adolf Hitler’s final moments.
• Contemplate the solitude and introspection that characterized this pivotal moment in history.
• Interact with a (singular) object in the room to trigger an introspective moment and gain insight into Hitler’s psyche during his final moments.
• Encourage deep reflection on the consequences of historical actions and the nature of power.
• Kill Hitler

NOTICE: Should feel profoundly impacted by the experience, there are two hidden keys that allow the player to either reset and re-experience these events, or minimize the window to exit the game.
